text: Bottle... Cloudy peach-colored pour with no head. The aroma is fruity and funky - lots of peach and damp, musty oak. Full-bodied with tingly carbonation. The flavor is fruity and lightly sour with a tart, yeasty finish. Very nice. Bottle courtesy of ctipping!

Bottle from a trade. Pours a hazy yellow with a white head. Nose is honey, sugar, lacto, and some tart. Flavor hits with peach, big lacto, some sweetness, and bits of wheat. Light in body and very nice overall.
Cloudy dark orange color. No head. Smells and tastes like a peach fruit cup. Medium light sourness. Long sweet juicy flavor.

Pours deep unclear orange with a few Islands of foam.. The nose has big lactic tart peach, Haribo ferskner, mineral earthy peach and slight citrus too. Great nose. The taste is tart initially with heavy peach, lactic tartness, fruity sweetness and a drying aftertaste. Mouthfeel is medium oily with light carbonation. Really liking this a lot. Thanks to beercation for this bad boy.

Pour a juicy deep orange, with a small white head. 
Aroma has plenty and plenty of peach juice, Peach candy, "Haribo ferskner" 
Slight barnyard, lactic sourness.
Taste is slightly sour jo front, but has some fruity sweetness. Very Well balanced. 
Medium bodied, with a medium but sparkling head. Pretty darn tasty.
Bottle shared by a friend. Hazy orange pour with a medium off-white head. Aroma of sweet malt, wheat and peach. Malty flavor with peach syrup, tartness and creamy wheat before a sour finish.

Bottle @ RBWG 2016. Thanks! Turbid orange colored beer with a white head. Theres a lot of Tangy peach as well as a touch of sweetness. Some dried pineapple, apricot, and peach preserve. Lemon juice sourness along with a bit of lactic yogurt character. A touch of cereal flavor and sweetness to this, sort of like Wheaties, maybe. A bit more funky than expected.

From notes. 4-5 ish oz pour on draft at FoBAB on November 21. The pour is a little different. Its a murky orange gold color with a thin layer of white colored head and no lace as it vanishes. There is a sour lemon skin at the beginning of the aroma. A solid peach slowly moves in and its got a strong mustiness. This is a unique smell for sure. Musty and juicy with a tart and sour lemon. The flavor is excellent. There is a ton of peach juice. Its like Im eating one of the damn things. There is a beautiful tartness and just a hint of souring toward the back end. The mouth feel is light and crisp, dry and tart, with a light carbonation and a lingeringly dry peachy finish. This is very good. If it werent for the off aromas, this would be phenomenal.

750ml bottle brought by bananab!11 and shared by all on Christmas Eve. Lovely sweet and tartness from the fruits, led by the peaches. By far the best brew for style had to date, and best of a very good night of tasting. 15.7
sample at fobab pours an orange gold with a thin white head. tastes just like peach juice. amazing beer

UPDATED: DEC 5, 2015 Bottle. Pours murky Arnold Palmer, small fizzy of white head, some residual and lacing. Aroma is stonefruit, lactic, lemon, , peach flesh. Flavor is light tart, lots of stone fruit, a bit earthy, lemon, musky, lingering tartness that increases in prominence in the finish. Fairly robust body. Faint touch of acetone

Hazy prange color with a very small head. Medium peach aroma, hints of lemon tartness. Great flavor ofmdey wheat and sweet peach. Moderate tartness, just enouh to be forceful but not overpowering. Dry finish
yum yum yum. This is fantastic. Huge natural peach flavors with a tart wheaty base. finish is all tart peach. Aroma is peach. Not that fake peach aroma. Love it.

Bottle. Colour...cloudy , medium amber with no head. Nose...peach purée, oak and vanilla essence. Palate...very peachy, with vanilla creme and oak.
The peach lingers all about and the vanilla is even stronger than before. The finish is medium long and oaky.
750 ml bottle. Pours a cloudy orange color with a small white head. A huge sweet peach nose. The flavor is big sweet peach, woody, very smooth. Awesome.

On tap at GTMW 2015

Poured from a bottle, this release captured my attention due to a deScriptive entry in the program guide. Im glad I stopped by because the experience was just shy of world class. The only thing I might disagree with is that it tastes much more like an American wild ale than anything that resembles a berliner weisse.

Aroma / Appearance - A hazy peach colored body glistens beneath weak snowflake tinted flecks of foam. Tart peach pie hones in on the goal with a bright crisp focus.

Flavor / Palate - Peaches that have soured in the can open with a metallic acidic tang. The dry finish opens up slowly with waves of salt. Regardless of how you pigeonhole this beer the results are top notch. I wish I had been able to bring a bottle home to share with the locals.

a pretty ridiculous beer .. . peach, apricot, citrus, tangy babies, and summer fruit .. . medium to high sour level .. crisp and tangy, really great sour, youll sure to love it! .. . . you should never throw a bong kid, ever.

Bottle (750 ml) at tasting. Shared by Luk_, thanks! Cloudy-milky-dirty orangey with a small ring of white foam. I couldnt say its good looking. Aroma is incredibly peachy and juicy. Theres also a moderate tartness that seems to carry the peach flavor even more. Its a bit lactic, but not just plain lactic as some boring Berliner Weisse... theres definitely some complexity and depth here, its just that its a bit hidden a metric fu**ton of peaches. Taste isnt too sour and, like aroma, its massively peach forward. Body is medium. Carbonation is medium as well. Juicy peaches finish. Its kind of drinkable because its not too puckering, but its also so peachy that it could get cloying. That being said,this is a pretty solid fruited Berliner.

Bottle shared by Luk_, thanks dude! It pours just like a glass of peach juice, still-looking with just a thin white rim that leaves no lacing. Nose is of peach juice and nicely fruity. Taste is moderately tart and offers more peaches. Body is light, carbonation moderately high and mouthfeel is juicy. Lightly puckering. Nice and juicy, this is not overdone and quite tasty!

bottle shared by luck, thanks bro! cloudy pale golden with a small white cap, some retention and lacing. tender fresh peaches, almost jammy, ginger snaps, spicy wheat, wood, light acidity - relatively complex flora, i.e. not only lactic; bright carbonation, light to medium body; drying, gently astringent and woodsy-spicy finish. bright peaches - gently woody. good!

Bottle. Murky orange pour with thin receding white head. Aroma is suuuper peachy, light citrusy tartness, very light lactic notes. Taste is sweet, very very fruity, tons of fleshy peach. Palate is med bodied, light carbonation. A bit unidimensional but quite tasty.

750 mL bottle. Very hazy without a head. Bright orange. Smell is strong peach. A little wheat and acidity. Taste is equally peachy. A little grainy. Sourness builds into the finish and becomes very strong, especially for a berliner. Medium low carbonation. Excellent peach flavor, but not much else going on.
Bottle. Hazy golden Orange pour with white head. Strong peach, fruit, light tart aromas. Light tartness, peach, fruit and sour tones.
750 ml. shared bottle. Pours a cloudy golden orange with a small white head. Aroma of peaches and tropical fruit. Taste is tart peaches, tropical fruit, and some funk. Mild tartness. Very good.

750 ml. bottle. It pours a cloudy yellow orange color with a disappearing head. Very fizzy though. The aroma has some nice peach flesh, hints of creamy vanilla and funk. The flavor has abundant sour peaches, lemony lactic acid, hints of funk, very low levels of acetic acid. Pretty creamy and lactic on the palate. The finish is tart and peachy. A good sour, but a bit muddled.

i know this is considered a beer, but sure tastes like a peach prosecco. slightly salty and sweet flavors with a strong peach backbone. pours light yellow in color with a white head. aroma of peaches. had a glass at beer temple.

Draft on tap at Great Taste of the Midwest 2015 (MadisonN WI). Pours a murky orange amber hue, firmer haziness, frothy tannish head atop is decent sized, nice retention and solid lacing. Aromas are peachy and tart, flaked wheat and subtle fruit meet mellow yogurt. Earth, a bit of dough, more sweet and tart peachy goodness. Initial is lighter end of the fold, intense peachy goodness, apricot pit and nice twangy lactic appeal. Mellow bready malts, more peach nectar and and tart twangy life. Delicious nectar, sour and on point without overwhelming. A perfect summery berliner full of flavor and life. Twangy trail out, sour peaches and bit of citric life. Just lovely. Not the prettiest pour but a damn good beer.

Bottle. Pours a hazy apricot orange color with a quick soapy white head that dissipates to a very tiny collar. Aroma is strong tart juicy peach some yeast. Taste is bitter tart almost sour, with big juicy peach flavor slight yeast. Palate is medium sticky juicy and dry. A must try for anyone liking sour tart beers!

GTMW 2015. Cloudy yellow. Low carbonation. Lots of peach flavor and aroma. It is sour, with perceivable yeast and fruit, and probably the most intense fruit flavor I have had in a Schells beer aside from the "Too Many Peaches," which I believe was a one off. In any event, this beer is sour, and blended well with the peaches.
Large format bottle, 750 I think, dont know its a weird shape. Decent amount of peach flavor. Not super intense. medium sour with a touch of barnyard. Nicely balanced sour. Good stuff

Bottle thanks to Eric. Pours a cloudy orange with small white head that diminishes to nothing. The aroma is strong peach juice and nectarine. Thin mouth, tart peach, light funk, straight peach juice, really enjoyed this one.

(750ml bottle) cloudy bright peach, nose of ridiculously sour peaches, real fruit, lacto, yogurt and great bug mix. Taste of tart peach, lacto, no vinegar, touch of Brett, and pedio too. Nice peach sour, really great!
Pour at the Great Taste of the Midwest. Hazy peach color with a slight white head. Tart and big time peachy. A smidge harsh on the finish.
Bottle sample at GTMW 2015. Hazy light golden color, white head. Aroma of fruity peach, vanilla. Taste has vanilla, stone fruit, citrus. Just lightly tart.
Pours a murky golden orange with a thick white head. Aroma of peaches, white vinegar and wheat. Taste is sour, vinegar, oak and peach with a bready finish. More like a wild ale than a Berliner.
Pouring at Where The Wild Beers Are 2015. Pours a hazed amber. Sweet peach puree on the nose. Medium bodied, tangy, light sweet acid. Funk, musk. Tangy peaches and wheat.

Bottle pours a murky orange/golden with a medium white head. Aroma of musky unripe peach/apricot/skins. Nice level of peach, not syrupy or overly sweet, fruit tartness works with creamy tart lacto. Pretty nice, easy drinking and refreshing. Not worth all the hype, but tasty nonetheless.
Wonderful and interesting beer, will be picking up another bottle. Peach and peach skin, some lemon and orange, light wheat. Tart and citrusy.

Courtesy of mrebeks
Bottle: The aroma consists of huge peach with a touch of lemon. Its pours a murky golden-orange with a small white head that quickly fades to a minimal film outlined by a very fine ring. The flavor starts with big tart peach. He finish turns more sour with moderate lemon. Its light-medium bodied with mild carbonation.
Bottle thanks to mrebeks. Aroma is fleshy peach, orange juice, and wheat. Tastes like extreme pulpy peach. Crazy amount of peach. Some light wheat too. Medium to full body. Crazy good.

$15 bomber poured into some champagne flutes per Schells on label suggestion. Appearance is awesome - nice and opaque cloudy peachy orange. Heavy sediment in the bottle bottom. Lively foam on the pour. Aromas of peach and wheat sourness. Taste is more tart than peach, but the peach is there on the back end for a great finish. Bubbly and delicious. My favorite of the Noble Star series to date.
UPDATED: OCT 17, 2015 June 19, 2015 - bottle shared by Bob. Orangish yellow pour with limited head. Nice aroma and taste of peaches, grain and maybe some oak/wood.
Bomber shared by Brandon - thanks! Dense hazy yellow pour with a small white head. Peach, some density to the palate, some orange - a Sunny D kind of feel on the tongue. Awesome.

Thanks to whomever added to database since been waiting tom upload rating and found no online info to add beer. This was donated to Where the Wild Beers Are Brooklyn along with rest of Noble Stars thanks Schell! Nose is super fresh peach. Tastes of fuzzy peach skin and ripe peach, wheat, straw, lacto, quite tart. Medium carbonation. Pretty delicious.

UPDATED: SEP 15, 2016 Sampled from the Firkin at Happy Gnome Firkin Fest 2015. Pours a murky, milky peach with a white head that lasts throughout the beer. Aroma has a beautiful peach note with a slight tartness and a light wheat underlying. Flavor has beautiful tart peach with a light sourness and a underlying wheat note.

Pour on tap at Northern Lights Rare Beer Fest, very hazy golden pour with white head, aroma brought notes of big peach, peach jam, tart lemon into some nice vanilla, touch of salty notes with a hint of slight oak. Taste was similar, nice peach, apricot into some vanilla, touch of oak into a bit of mineral, funk, finishing slightly tart, slightly sweet.
